intro: Heladena albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered heladena, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Heladena albiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
